title: 114_hr5663
content: The Act is titled the "Four C's for Careers Act" and aims to provide high-quality career and technical education opportunities. Section 135 of the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include a range of industries identified through business and community partnerships, including work-based learning experiences. Additionally, induction programs and preparation are emphasized in the amendment. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include teaching high-quality dual and concurrent enrollment career and technical education programs, encouraging best practices among practitioners, and utilizing blended learning programs. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include strategies for improving critical thinking, communications, collaboration, and creativity skills of students in career and technical education programs. This includes developing open educational resources and creating supportive physical environments for student engagement. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include training career guidance counselors to use labor market information, supporting public-private partnerships for student credentials, and integrating academic and career education programs. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include promoting skills for in-demand occupations, work-based learning opportunities with industry professionals, and conducting a needs assessment for greater engagement with business and industry. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include promoting skills for in-demand occupations, work-based learning opportunities with industry professionals, and exploring the unique technology, transportation, and special needs of rural and low-income communities. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to promote critical thinking, collaboration, communication, and creativity. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include critical thinking, collaboration, communication, and creativity skills in various sections. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include improving critical thinking, communication, collaboration, and creativity skills of students in career and technical education programs through project-based learning, educator training, and ongoing support.
